intro: Chisocheton rhytidocalyx, commonly known as the rough-barked chisocheton, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and simple, alternate leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in axillary or terminal inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
